Still the same [asp.net](http://asp.net "asp.net") example, to pass the Singleton to different handler of the same request.  
Using callcontext can reliable pass data, even I use configAwait(false) directly before access to CallContext.LogicalData, correct?  
If that's true, what advantage does HttpContext.Current hold? HttpContext.Current requires SyncContext, while CallCotext.LogicalData doesn't, yet they can do the same thing, why would one use HttpContext.Current?
